CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A2 reads: "New NAACP Life Members - Nine new members hold their certificates of Life Membership ($500) in National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, which they purchased or pledged, Sunday, during the "Fashions for Freedom" show, at the Hotel Penn-Sheraton. The brilliant fashion review, which featured the appearance of Mrs. Marguerite Belafonte, star of the extravaganza, and Sara Lou Harris, beautiful cover-girl, both of New York City, was sponsored by the local Life Membership Committee for the benefit of the NAACP's "Freedom Fight."  Left to right are new life members: Lee Smith, businessman; Dr. Raymond Primas, dentist; Miss Ann Martin, teacher; Mmes. Grace Morgan and Gay DeHall, the latter representing the D.I. Club; Mrs. Belafonte, Mrs. Birdie Dunlap, owner of the Hurricane Lounge; Mrs. Sue Corsey, representing The Pittsburghers Club; Atty. Henry R. Smith Jr., co-chairman of the local Life Membership Committee; John C. Moore, "senior citizen." and Percy A. Garland of the Carter-DiNino Studios Inc., photographers, McKeesport.  Mrs. K. Leroy Irvis, co-chairman of the Hill Area NAACP membership drive, is credited with obtaining life members, Mrs. Dunlap and L. Smith.  A surprising overflow crowd jammed the Pittsburgh Room of the hotel to view the fashion show. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of new NAACP life members, left to right: Lee Smith, Dr. Raymond Primas, Ann Martin, Grace Morgan, Gay DeHall, Marguerite Belafonte, Birdie Dunlap, Sue Corsey, Atty. Henry R. Smith Jr., John C. Moore, and Percy A. Garland, standing in the Hotel Penn-Sheraton, another version
